website_summaries.verdict: An easy-to-use bike repair stand that is lightweight and folds up for easy storage
pros: This full aluminum alloy stand has a 360° clamp that attaches to the top tube or seat post
Despite its light weight of 10.75 lbs., this stand is sturdy and well built

customer_reviews.title: Quality control problem
customer_reviews.text: Stand arrived yesterday and I opened it only to discover it is missing a bolt that holds the head on the post. Rather than going through the hassle of returning it, will try to find a replacement part at hardware store. This is just stupid sloppy quality
customer_reviews.author: claycodc

customer_reviews.title: Nice But Check For Small But Significant Defects in Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Very well built rack. Better than I expected but I encountered one flaw. The nut and bolt allows you tighten the big clamp were defective. It worked fine the first two days then the nut would only screw on the first 1\4 of the bolt then slide the rest of the way because the nut suddenly became too big for the bolt. It seems like a simple fix to replace them both instead of sending the whole thing back. The drawback may be that I would not be able to use the original tightening handle anymore because the propietary bolt has a ball on top to make the handle fit. An update will follow.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne White

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, works great.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this can't be beat. Very sturdy, but still light enough to carry or throw in your trunk if needed. The clamp mechanism is composite...heavy duty plastic and should last for years of normal use. The stand has just enough lean to it so that its stable but you can add a sandbag to the legs if you want. I have a 27lb mtb on it and there's no way it'll tip over. Easy to set up and adjust. Very happy I went with this instead of the $280 Park Tools version.
customer_reviews.author: IAHphotog

customer_reviews.title: Missing Vital Part
customer_reviews.text: I received my bike repair stand today and it is missing the locking handle for the clamp rotation. This stand is unusable without this part. The unit came in a sealed bag so I don’t think it was the reseller’s fault. The rest of the stand looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: CPSHEF

customer_reviews.title: Great for ebikes and a small folded footprint.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my Haibike Fullnine RC ebike. Ebikes are heavier than comparable counterparts so I was a bit concerned as to whether or not the stand would support my bike. It does without any issue. With battery the bike weighs 50 pounds. The other reason I purchased this was for it's small footprint when folded. It's a great stand from both a support and small footprint standpoint. I highly recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kitaoka

customer_reviews.title: Good stand if you are not working on the bike
customer_reviews.text: This stand is for a very light or kids bike. Put a 40 pound bike on it and wanted to tip any time I touched it. Put a Yeti 30 pound Carbon on it and still felt like the collar on top was going to snap, especially at the swivel part on the top. It is lightweight though and does look good when set up, just not with a bike on it. If you own an expensive bike, spend the extra for the Feedback Sports Elite. Bought this one first and returned after just 1 day after thinking this would hold up. Just got the Feedback Sports and no comparison. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: pudgecake

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product until reading this review
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this item, take a $100 dollar bill and light it, because there is no written or stated warranty for this product. I (and other customers) have asked this question of the seller with nothing but silence in return. The problem is that the clamp that holds the bicycle is plastic and shows definite evidence of being overwhelmed by the weight of my mountain bike (45 lbs). If you are lucky at the casino, have a very light bicycle, don't plan to use this stand very much, then definitely buy it. Otherwise, find a different stand with a warranty. This is not up to the general Amazon standard and should be investigated.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Chris

customer_reviews.title: If you're willing to spend your time and/or money to fix it, then you might like this.
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the collars/clamps do not tighten all the way (the plastic cuffs need to have a smaller circumference), so the top extension tube slides back down and/or the bike falls forward. I could take the cuffs off, grind some material off, and put them back on, but I shouldn't have to do that, especially given that this stand is NOT the cheapest one out there by any stretch. (Other reviewers have used other workarounds, e.g., a hose clamp, but again, why should we have to do that?) If they fix the cuffs, I'd give it 4 stars (not 5, because the cuffs are plastic). But for now, it's going back....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kurowski

customer_reviews.title: Folds up nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way higher quality than I expected for the price. Folds up nice and compact, and is plenty stable for your average wrenching. For the average garage wrenching on your bike, I don't really think there's much need to spend more than the eighty nine this cost, unless you're just so loaded that you have to have the best of everything. Only time will tell how well this will hold up, but I have high expectations from it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Steele

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Stand
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm liking this stand. It's fairly strong and stable. Not sure I 'd push the weight limit. It holds my bike with the front wheel on the ground, so I can clean the chain pretty easily. A lot of parts are made of some kind of plastic composite. Seems strong enough. The locking bands for the height adjustment have metal where it counts and composite for grip. I maybe should have gotten the bigger one, but didn't want to pay the price. I'll update if I have problems. So far, it's OK!
customer_reviews.author: Gordy G.

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk..... The mounting clamp does not tighten up enough. Plus it will scratch your paint. The stand is unstable. Don't try torquing anything while on the stand. It will fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and setup. Everything works and moves exactly as you’d expect. This has all the functionality I need for cycle maintenance. The only complaint is the upper arm is a little wobbly, maybe with a little adjusting I can tighten things up. Made mostly of metal and durable plastics, this should hold up to private use for many years. I am not sure I would buy this for a professional repair shop unless it was a backup. With a wide range of height and angle variability there is no problem getting my bike into a good position for what I am working on. Minor quibbles aside, this is a great value and highly functional product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use & Very Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Far better than the 25 y/o Park home mechanic stand I have. The clamping mechanism is very easy to use and suitable for today's non-circular tubing. The stand is very light and easy to adjust. I particularly like the ability to get much of the bike up to eye level. Makes a big difference. The downside to the weight and height is the stability. I wouldn't try to remove a seized bottom bracket with the stand at full height. For the other 99% of the time, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: goldsbar

customer_reviews.title: 8 months later
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stand for 8 months. With 3 bikes, I use it very often. I clamp the seat post of my 30 pound hard tail mountain bike and clamp the top tubes of my hybrid/commuter and my gravel bikes. I have done a lot of maintenance and upgrades with this stand, have used it for washing my bikes, and some times just park a bike on it. Absolutely no problems. I feared the plastic gear that rotates the top would be sub-par, but it does just fine. No complaints. Worth the money spent. In fact, it has paid for itself over and again. Just thought I would let you all know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, however  can break easily if not careful. Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: As a stand it works great, however, some parts are cheaply made. It tipped over backwards when I was trying to put a bike on it. Would be nice if it had just a little kickstand to prevent that. When it tipped, I half caught it with my leg but it still fell on the tool plate and it completely broke off the tool plate. The plastic is of very cheap quality. I can't even glue it together because of how bad it broke. Wish they had extra parts to order but I can't find any. Hope they read my message and send me an extra tool plate my way.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for less than the Blue Brand.
customer_reviews.text: This Bike Hand stand is great for a home garage. Sturdy frame that gets the bikes up to where I can work on them and very compact when folded down to store away. With 8 bikes in the garage, we're constantly tweaking, repairing, or changing parts on something. At 6'10", its not easy to bend down to mess with bottom brackets and brakes. This stand holds even my heavier MTB with no problems and gets everything to a nice working height. The included tool tray is OK...but as I keep this set up next to my work bench, it becomes a parts catcher on the bench instead of the stand. All in all, a GREAT product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: You want to know if it's as good as the blue one. You already know the answer. Nevertheless, it's a good stand. I use it often, usually just to wash my gravel bike. If you've never owned a stand before, life it too short to go without; it's a very, very useful thing to have, and you'll find yourself doing a lot more maintenance that you otherwise would (which is a good thing). The hardware needs some grease - it's cheap chrome plated and rusts if I don't keep it greased. Don't worry about it tipping or anything like that - it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Stand
customer_reviews.text: WOW, just WOW. I got turned onto this stand from people's post on Seth's Bike Hacks Facebook Group and damn I am glad I got this over those high priced ones like park tool. Dont get me wrong park tool makes great products but this one you shouldnt pass up. Sturdy, well made, easy to use, folds smooth and fits into small spaces when not in use. Good buy, dont pass this up when looking for a stand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good portability
customer_reviews.text: This stand has been amazingly useful. I used it in outfitting two gravel bikes with fenders and racks with great results. When the job was done, the stand folded up compactly for storage. I was impressed with the stability and ease of use. This is great for someone with occasional maintenance needs but wouldn't be ideal for a bike shop. Great stand at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: O. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  What an incredible find!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What an incredible find! I have been looking at lightweight and portable stands for sometime. I read some of the reviews on here and skipped over at first. However, this stand kept popping up. So, I pulled the trigger and it arrived today. I opened the box and setup took me about 30 seconds. Granted, my bike only weighs about 16 pounds not loaded and about 17.3 loaded, but this stand holds it like a champ. Another awesome option is that the arm articulates so you can elevate the front, level the bike, or raise the rear of the bike for access. For the price I think this thing is a steel.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality assembly
customer_reviews.text: I’m modifying my review as I was very upset when I first unboxed it. The product ie very sturdy and folds up nicely. You may need pliers to release the quick release as the were closed way to tight. I’m 6’ and 200+ pounds and had to use large water pump pliers to open one of mine. My biggest peeve was that the bike clamp was missing a linchpin making the stand useless. Latter, I found the pin in the bottom of the heavy plastic bag that the Stan was packed in. However, there is nothing to hold the pin in place and it will fall out easily on its own and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: Keeps collapsing - may not be safe
customer_reviews.text: The friction materials they use to grip and hold the stand in working position, are not good quality. When you're working on a bike suspended on the stand, the top tube keeps sliding down inside the bottom tube. And the whole thing keeps inclining. I tried to stiffen both clips as much as possible, still not working reliably. Though its cheaper than the Park Tool one, this doesn't mean it can be of cheaper quality. If you want to buy it, be aware of what you want to do on the suspended bike, and what force you want to apply. Otherwise, the whole thing may collapse and it may not be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the stand is locked before you load the bike.
customer_reviews.text: E bike pictured is about 80 lbs. stand is very stable. I’m still lifting the 80 lb bike into the clamp but once there is is better than bending over for a long time. It was nice to be able to clean and lube the gears and derailers at standing level. No interference turning the peddles. Just make sure the stand is fully locked before you lift the bike, if it isn’t, I will fold up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fair priced bike service!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it works great! I fix my carbon road bike (clamp on seat post), my mountain bike and my wife's mountain bike on this. Easy to open and store for later. It has worked all summer and I think it will hold up well. Easy rotation for flipping bike to get to other things (tall person issues). It would get 5 stars if it was a little tippy sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: mnchrisjensen

customer_reviews.title: just an honest review
customer_reviews.text: the only reviews I post are when a product simply does not work to the standard it should. I have had this stand for over a year now and I knew it was just not a good stand when I find myself trying not to use it... set up and take down is not easy or user friendly whether you are a new to the sport of season cyclist... when you do get the bike set up on the stand itself it is very easy for the bike and stand to fall to the ground together. pay the extra $ (like I should have) and go for a quality stand like park tool... thanks. ///kt
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty much the cheapest option I could find that had good reviews, so I wasn't expecting a professional level stand. And it isn't one; You're going to experience a good amount of wobblyness when working on your bike in this stand. But again, I'm not sure you could avoid this and still have the stand be portable and foldable. You'd need a fixed holder, or maybe a stand that weighs 50lbs. If I realized that it would be wobbly, I still probably would have gone with this because I'm cheap and just need the stand for standard maintenance on my light road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Bobo

customer_reviews.title: My First Bike Stand /  Life is Easier With This Tool
customer_reviews.text: As so many others have done, recently I got back into cycling as an alternative form of outdoor exercise. I go tired of & frustrated with turning my bike upside down to work on it... so I thought I'd look into getting a stand. I love this. Obviously I'm not a "tech" but this stand makes me look like one; LOL. Working on my bike is so much easier with this stand and my confidence to "tinker" around is growing. The stand itself seems sturdy and well made. So far, so good. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: great bike stand!!!!  but....
customer_reviews.text: holds the weight of the bike with out fear of the bike and/or stand falling over and the work tray works great too! but if you have a mountain bike dropper post and is trying to clamp onto the dropper post then forget it. The clamp does not close down onto the dropper post enough. I wish the company would have mentioned this on the descriptions. If they correct this I would have made a 5 star review, but this one little flaw is why I am only giving it 2 stars, cause it only works on my fitness road bike and not my main use mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Low quality plastic mount and stand
customer_reviews.text: This product is of poor quality and does not support bicycles in a sturdy manner. I’d recommend purchasing something different. I would return this by amazon allows only 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid build at great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bike stand I've owned so I don't have anything to compare it against but this thing sure seems good to me. It's much sturdier than I expected for the price and has a great finish and look to it. It was super easy to unpack and set up. I had it out of the box and holding my bike in about five minutes. It folds up tightly and fits nicely in a corner. CAUTION: be careful when folding it up the first time as there are pinch points. You'll only make that mistake once, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand, it's better than I expected it to be. Very solid & sturdy, easily adjustable. I set it up in a couple of minutes and then tried three different bikes on it, they are all different styles so I had to adjust for each one but the stand was able to accommodate them easily. One is an older cruiser style (very heavy) but no issues! One note - the tray is only magnetized under one section, I was expecting the whole tray to be magnetized. Easily fixed though, I just taped some magnets under the other large section. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Andy10K

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and cheaper than park tools
customer_reviews.text: While I love my local bike shops I find it much more satisfying and cost-effectivity to buy the tools to do the jobs my self. The price for this item was less than the cost the shop wanted to service my bikes. running cables and adjusting derailers isn't that hard just takes some patients and youtube. The thing is larger than I thought but it holds up sturdy and has the right pivots to move the bike around. Very pleased that it's already paid for itself in service savings.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle C

customer_reviews.title: First impressions
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect when first looking for one of these. Was afraid of a cheap camera tripod build type of a stand. This actually is a well built beast. Set it up, locked the bike in, and did the work i needed it for with no issues. Had no fears of it tipping. No worries about spinning those pedals hard and the stand barley flinched. Can't speak to the longevity but don't regret this purchase ao far. Think the packaging could have a little more protective padding. The shipper was rough on the battered box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient stand, but a little too light
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this stand constantly for 5 years. It does a good job in general, but it's very light, which causes it to be somewhat unstable. More than once, I've had a bike in there, taken a wheel out, and had the stand tip over due to the imbalance. I've now gotten used to keeping a foot on one of the legs to prevent this. Also make sure you fully tighten, maybe even over tighten, the quick release levers. If they're even the tiniest bit loose, the weight of your bike can cause the legs to fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price for such good quality.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I don't think you are going to beat it. I think its right up there with the higher priced units It's sturdy, and we'll built. Comes with a tool tray that folds up. It has a nice clear coat on the stand to protect it. Any part that is plastic is heavy duty and not flimy. It comes fully assembled and ready to use. The legs are easy to fold, the extension up and down give.you plenty of height, and the head clamp is easy to articulate.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand and good price
customer_reviews.text: If you do much bike maintenance and repair, you want a stand. If you want to limit your investment, you want THIS stand. I have used it on multiple mountain, hybrid, and road bikes ranging from 20 - 34 lbs. To avoid damaging the bicycle frame, I always clamp on the seat post. To avoid pushing hard against the stand when removing tight pedals or crank arms, I pull on the wrench while pushing on the crank arm. I also took the bike off the stand to remove bottom bracket cups. The stand is very stable, and seems well made. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, clunky, horrible
customer_reviews.text: Hate this bike stand. It is really hard to adjust the camp to use it attached to the seatpost.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with imperfections
customer_reviews.text: I tend to be a perfectionist so I gave this a total of four stars as it arrived with a few scratches and dings. I’m debating on whether or not to return it for a fresh replacement. I’ll update again if I do or if the manufacturer/seller reaches out to me after reading this review. However, on the functionality of this item, it works perfectly. Exactly as described. Very sturdy. I’d suggest lubing the joints for longevity but overall, I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Expected shipping time. Very nice bike rack with no assembly required right out of the box. Rack holds both bikes solidly with very little movement while working on them. Just know this is not a commercial grade or bike shop rack that can withstand unlimited use or abuse. It would cost a great deal more for that. But, for the home mechanic doing occasional repairs and cleaning, I expect to get years of service from it by having realistic expectations in regards to it's capabilities. Absolutely happy with the purchase as it priced fairly after comparing many other racks and this one stood out from the rest.
customer_reviews.author: gotta ride

customer_reviews.title: It's making my cleaning work easy..
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be sturdy. I have used it with my MTB's. It's good. Surely it's not like the one pro use in bike stores. But it's definitely the one I wanted for my apartment usage in my small balcony area. It's definitely good. Hope to review later if at all anything doesn't seem right. As of now it's perfect(above review is for June 15th 2016 purchase). Below is addition on Aug 28,2019. Mine didn’t come with magnetic plate for tools. I just was looking for Spin doctor and I saw that the one I had ordered in 2016 hadn’t come with magnetic plate. That’s a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist38

customer_reviews.title: Great strand but not for ood shape non-tubular frames
customer_reviews.text: This stand is very well built and works great for minor tuning of most bicycles. It is not as stable as some of the higher priced ones, so if you do heavy wrenching you may want to look at the Park Tools stand. My only complaint with this stand is if toy have a odd shaped frame (I have a Canyon) the clamp doesn't grab it very well. It's better for traditional tube frames.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K Lindauer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I expected. It came in the box virtually ready to use and was easy to set up. I used it right away to do some much needed work on my bike. It is very light weight and easy to fold up for storage. The only thing is it could be a little more sturdy but then it would heavier and not as easy to fold. So that is a very minor issue. If you are doing some basic work on your bike this stand is a must have because it allows you to adjust the bike to a level that makes it easier to work on.
customer_reviews.author: SSMZ

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: As a stand this works great. It is stable if you keep you bike centered. The adjustments all work well and the entire assembly collapses into a small area for easy storage. One problem - the tool/part shelf is a pain to get on. The acres rub against the black plastic of the main frame. When it takes 20 seconds to break down the stand it shouldn’t take 3 or 4 min to get two screws in. The shelf went in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: a must for anyone who works on their bicycle
customer_reviews.text: super easy to use. quality seems great. I like the rotating clamps and flexibility it allows. definitely makes it easier to work on your bike. the finish on the product also makes it look very nice. its lightweight enough to move around yet sturdy enough to hold my full suspension mtb bike. I like the ability to fold this and store or carry with you if needed. a great buy overall for the price
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Big brand
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh...unbelievable product. The box the packaging was a prelude to the product. I thought I was pulling out some major tripod for a professional telescoping sports camera lens. Thos thing is gorgeous. Sturdy as I could have imagined. Easy to unfold, easy to assemble. Directing single page just incase. Clamp is perfect tool/parts tray is easy to set up. I immediately put my bike up on it and I am ready to get on some repairs. Great buy. Avoid the big brand unless you like to spend the extra for the color and the name.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon L Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Everything I hoped it would be (plus some)!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a birthday present and couldn't be happier with it. I use it both with my road bike and my mountain bike. It feels very well made and holds anything I put on it. The tray to hold tools and little pieces has been unexpected useful. It folds up quickly when I need the extra space. It's adjustable so you can clamp on the seat post or the cross bar. All in all, great stand, and hard to argue with the price for such a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, great deal.
customer_reviews.text: WOW, I'm impressed. I have to admit my expectations were fairly low but I am pleasantly surprised. This stand is sturdy, well built, ready to use out of the box. The bike clamp is excellent, it's hard plastic but very well engineered. I'd but this against the Park Tool 9.2/10.2, I like the leg extension & locking mechanism better. I'd recommend to anyone needing a good, folding bike stand. I'm very happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: PcW

customer_reviews.title: Worth the additional money over the lesser brands!
customer_reviews.text: I was really close to purchasing one of the competing products at 1/2 the price. They look the same and appear to have the same features. However, I kept reading reviews of striped screws and locking mechanisms which lacked durability. For these reasons I purchased this stand from BikeHand and have not been disappointed. I have used it to do a fork and headset upgrade, bike washing and derailleur adjustment. I highly recommend this stand and believe it will last me for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Did my research before buying a repair stand so that I can wash and do basic maintenance tasks on my bike and most reviews put this stand as best value. it is that and then some. Comes with a tool tray to keep your parts and tools organized. Folds down easily and supports all my bikes well. Is a bit bulky to be lugging out to races or tours in your trunk but for a home stand is very well put together.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was not sure it would hold my hybrid. Then I was reading about people having issues with it not keeping their bikes elevated or would slip down. I purchased it, thought, why not. The first day, I set it up (really easy), then I opened the clamp and extended it fully, placed my bike in the clamp, then walked out of the garage. 2 days later, exactly where I had put it with no slippage. Works for me! I use it to clean my bike, adjust things, and everything else. I also use it to hold while I put on proofide on my saddle. No issues even when cleaning the chain and reoiling.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great stand especially for the price. Done work 3 bikes in the week I have had it. Held my XL stumpjumper to replace crankset, youngest boys bike for same reason then custom built from bare frame for my oldest son. Stand never had me concerned or thinking about being extra careful. One thing, make sure it's on even ground, will not like ground that's too uneven if holding bikes by seat post as I do.
customer_reviews.author: RAKC

customer_reviews.title: Weight your bike
customer_reviews.text: Product is great for light weight bike, anything weight over the 35 lbs will risk the stand collapsed and the bike will fall over. The failure point is at the plastic neck. Purchase the 110 stand if your bike is weight over 35 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: For the price it’s maybe the best stand out there
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s maybe the best stand out there. It’s plenty stable to me. Seems it will work well for the garage mechanic. Would easily work for most maintenance tasks. If I had to hammer a fork out or an old press fit bottom bracket I would use sand bags on the stand base and maybe brace the bike more but I really like it. Very lightweight and fold up fairly small. I added a pic of the interior of the jaws. It’s a rubber like material that seems fairly durable and won’t harm the finish of the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand
customer_reviews.text: The description says it all - it's light, portable and strong. I love this bike repair stand. It's the first I've owned but I don't need to own others to know that this one is so well designed and built. I use it regularly to service my road bikes and I've had no issues to complain about. Just clean it after every use and store away properly and this should go for many, many years. It's just perfect, that's all I can say. Doesn't shake one bit. I highly recommend this stand. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good thing as there were no real instructions
customer_reviews.text: Quick and intuitive to set up. Good thing as there were no real instructions. Looks great. My son's old Schwinn loaded up easily. Creaked a bit, creaked even more with my much heavier Gary Fisher mountain bike that has been converted to an electric assisted cruiser that is pretty damn heavy. It holds it, but was creaking from the quick releases pretty badly while repairing a rear derailleur. Breaks down and stores fast. Probably 80 percent as good as a Park Tools professional shop stand for a fifth of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McElhineyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great value on a solid stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make it easier to do maintenance on my wife's racing bikes, and I was pleasantly surprised when it also had no issues holding my 55lb e-bike while I swapped out some components. Like with any other rack, it would help to have a third arm to hold the bike while you tighten the clamp, but it took just a minute. I've only used it a dozen times, but it's space efficient when folded up, and is solid as a rock when holding a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mike. R

customer_reviews.title: Impressive stability and lights weight.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, very stable. Easy adjustments to tube sizes and heights. This is an impressive stand. The aluminum frame tubes are large diameter, the cam lock levers are large and easy to adjust and lock down.
customer_reviews.author: Aune

customer_reviews.title: 🚵🏽‍♂️👈 it stands 😀
customer_reviews.text: I believe after 6 years dealing with my MTB this stand works perfect for light mechanics. If you are only correcting your gears and light works! My only concern is the stability, is not bad but could be better! What I like: Folds easy, is lightweight, I can put it near a wall and it don’t occupy lot of space, it’s a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Returned - I Received defective item - support phone number and site on Amazon is fake
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this - as mention in other reviews the angle handle lever (part five in instructions) doesn’t connect properly and so doesn’t work. Very disappointed. I tried to call and found the customer service number/website posted on Amazon is actually a furniture company. Bottom line - there is no service
customer_reviews.author: INTJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I bought this one. It is versatile and easy to use. The brackets down at the bottom where it folds are thicker and sturdier than they look in the pictures. Good value for what you get. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Keith SindersTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Most bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: No need to spend a ton on a name brand. This thing works great. Easily adjusts height and angle. Firm grasp on the bike. Jaws are soft but sturdy. Easily stows away. Looks very well made and designed. I really love it. If you're in the fence, go ahead, you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I used a >$200.00 bike stand for the last several years courtesy of my roommate. Once I moved out I was missing having access to a stand to do my regular bike maintenance on. I have a Surly Straggler; it's not the heaviest bike and it's definitely not the lightest bike. My bike is held firmly in place as I wrench away. I am 100% satisfied with the quality and durability of the stand, and I'm willing to say that this is the best bicycle-related purchase I've ever made besides my bike itself.
customer_reviews.author: CAS77

customer_reviews.title: Making bike repairs easy.
customer_reviews.text: I returned the bike repair stand because I was have a problem with the out riggers supporting wight of my carbon fiber road bike, I tried to tighten the clamp but the stand still leaned forward, I thought about putting an additional clamp on or drilling a hole in the main support and inserting a pin to prevent out rigger support clamp from sliding up on the main support. The bike clamp worked well holding the bike in place easy to use, and would like to have kept the stand , but did not want to do any modifications to it.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Vignali

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a repair stand but have been too cheap to buy one until now. This stand works pretty well considering the price. It’s got some pretty cool features for this price range, I really enjoy how easy it is to fold up and the tray is a nice touch. But, the stand can be a little wobbly if it’s not super tight and the clamp tends to move a lot because the teeth on the locking mechanism only work when they want to. At the end of the day I would still recommend this stand to anyone and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that I received all of the correct parts, and never needed to contact customer service. This stand has has held up to two full bike builds, and is used as storage/cleaning between rides. It is not the level of sturdiness/quality as the Park Tool stands, but it also price appropriately for that distinction. Yes, heavy torquing will require some support so that everything stays upright, but it is certainly doable. My only real complaint would be the clamp needs to be more smooth when opening/closing. I have an aluminum frame/post so I am not concerned about pressure, so this is just an ease of use issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this product was worthy of it. I was initially hesitant in spending this kind of money on a bike stand as I am a casual bike rider. That being said, this product is very high quality and worth every penny. I will keep this stand longer than any bike which makes it a great buy. Don't skimp to save a few dollars - this stand is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Dover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: I had thought it would have a strap or something to stabilize the front wheel from turning either way but it didn't. I'll have to rig something up as it needs to be stable when working on the bike with the back wheel lower than the front so that the rear wheel simply sits in the slot it is mounted in before tightening the axle nuts. Overall I like the tool as I don't have to work on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this stand!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my primary repair stand. It is light and easy to move around and it folds up nicely for storage. The tool tray is handy and holds all of my t-handle tools and small parts. I have repaired my mountain bikes, my carbon road bike and my heavy touring bike on this stand. If you set the clamp tension correctly, it holds a lot of weight. (My fully racked touring bike weighs over 40 pounds and I have used this stand to work on that bike many times without any issues.) I would recommend this to anyone who is not a professional bike technician and needs a quality stand for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Good (not great) stand
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a huge fan of the clamp. It works well, but it’s not a one squeeze clamp. It’s a clamp then twist to tighten. The twist to loosen then unclamp. The action is smooth. Just make sure they stay tight. There is no positive tension feedback and they will work lose. Folds up nicely. For the price, it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good for Occasional Maintenance and Repair
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a light weight stand that's fine for someone that doesn't work on a large stable of bicycles. It has a lot of plastic bits, and seems a little too flexy...but it does work well enough with my road, MTB, and CX bikes. As I've found myself working on other people's bikes more It's held up alright, but I suspect that I'll be needing something more substantial in the next year or two if the creaking from this stand is any indication. Or maybe I'll just fiberglass and epoxy the living crap out of the it.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Stand.  Holds every bike I own!
customer_reviews.text: This bike stand does the trick. It's sturdy, steady and holds every bike I own. Makes working on my bikes a breeze and the tray to hold bike tools and misc screws, nuts and bolts is a very nice touch. I recommend this stand to anyone who works on their own bike. For the price I paid I'd buy another one. Cannot recommend this bike stand enough. Makes working on my own bikes a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: College Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great item for small apartment
customer_reviews.text: Finding quality bike stands in a city can be a hassle. Storing them is even worse, especially in a small DC apartment. This item is a really great purchase and saved me from having to ride/walk to the nearby bike coop everytime my bike broke. It folds easily, supports the weight of a cyclocross bike well, is quickly adjusted and the additional tool tray is a welcomed add-on. It's a little bigger than a camping chair when folded. While it does take up a bit of closet space, it's much better than any alternative!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying this stand
customer_reviews.text: First things first. I have never owned a bicycle repair stand before. I had no idea which one to choose. I ended up buying this Cycle Pro Mechanic Stand. So far I really enjoy it. I feel spoiled. I love the way it unfolds and sets up in about 10 seconds. I also love the way it is so darn light! It is also very easy to adjust, and fold for storage when you are done using it. I feel it is a great stand for the money spent. Hope it is as durable, as it is convenient, over the years.
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Well Built Stand, I would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a stand for my garage that would allow me to do minor repairs. I was a little leery of buying this stand and was looking at going with a Park Tool stand. I read reviews and moved forward with this rack stand and I am glad I did. It arrived pretty well built, surprisingly. I showed some unboxing photos to show that minimal assembly is required. The stand feels very durable and well-built. This was a solid addition that will allow me to do a little bit of my own wrenching. Handled my fat tires 33lb weight with ease. I have no worries using this for either bike.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Lightweight and Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought bike stand not only for service/adjustments but also to wash. I was concerned parts some parts would rust (notably the springs and skewers). Glad to share after a thorough wash a month ago, the there is no sign of rust. See pic for more details. Pros: * Durable construction * Easy adjustment, leverages cycle skewers w/ quick release. * Sturdy and lightweight frame. * Good value Cons: * None so far
customer_reviews.author: Kim G. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works well and price is very reasonable
customer_reviews.text: The first item that I received had a defect but seller contacted me and issued a replacement right away. Seller was very easy to deal with, no phone calls, just emailed them the photo of the defect and a replacement was received after 2 days. No issue with the replacement and it has been working very well. This item is very well made, it does not look cheap and works the same way like the expensive ones. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking and buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the others. Comes assembled, high-quality materials, excellent finish and very strong and durable. I folded up and take it with me on my bike trips. I cannot say enough great things about this repair bike rack stand. You will be glad you choose this over its competitors. Quality excellent, durability excellent, price competitive, fit and finish excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Coach DDE

customer_reviews.title: Great stand perfect for garage mechanic
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this after years of crouching. I am an avid cleaner and adjuster on my rides. Overall very sturdy, decent pedal clearance and easy to store. Use for both road and mtb. The pivot clamp is very sturdy and easy to use. Sometimes put frames on wired angles and it can get a bit wobbly but I understand I did not buy a floor mounted stand. Great alien from cost and technical ability!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A throwaway
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting a sturdy stand that will last and make you a proud owner, don’t buy this. It is something you will probably quickly hate, break, and then throw away. It works. And visually looks fine. The legs are as obnoxiously in the way as they appear in the picture. The clamp is clunky plastic and oddly complicated to use. Not the first time, EVERY time. For the cost I would consider it an ok buy at best.
customer_reviews.author: Cancerman

customer_reviews.title: Papafrita bike stand...an artwork!
customer_reviews.text: I did try to find a flaw on this bike repair stand. It was non existent. It was delivered in a timely manner,kudos to the seller!. It’s light,practicadl and even beautiful! It does look so nice that I even left my Surly touring/commxuter bike on it instead of getting a rack. It’s on my balcony. Everybody ask me about the stand...a work of art!
customer_reviews.author: papafrita

customer_reviews.title: Tip for lifting bikes onto work stand.
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for DIY. Lightweight to the point it is wobbly, but it is designed to be portable / folded for compact storage. I am building a stable of electric fat bikes. They can be very heavy, so I purchased a rope bike hoist (Menards $10, available on Amazon also) to lift bikes up to work stand. I leave tension on the ropes to keep some weight off the stand, as I am sure my fat E bikes will exceed the rated capacity of stand. Even without the weight of motors and battery pack, using the hoist to lift bikes onto work stand is awesome, as I am lacking in upper body strength.
customer_reviews.author: JC Hobbes

customer_reviews.title: Its plastic where it counts.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It's ok. Plastic clamp. It works, but it's days are numbered out of the box. It looks good, but I'm already wary of it. If you can, buy the obnoxiously blue Park tool stand, it's got a metal clamp, which out to last longer. I do like the parts tray option. Overall... it works... for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the price and mobility
customer_reviews.text: The stand works well and folds up to be stacked against the wall in my garage. It's fairly stable, and holds bikes in multiple configurations. But we aware that bike frames have thick pipes and are more curvy than they used to be. That can make it a challenge to hold the bike frame well in any bike stand. This one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile - Follow Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to get a maintenance stand - now I can't live without it. This stand works quite well and does everything claimed. I've used it to change tires, air up, clean chain and gears and adjust brakes. Other reviews I've read had comments about weak plastic teeth and I can see how that could be a problem if you don't follow instructions and make sure the teeth are fully engaged and the clamp tightened. It folds up nicely and fits in a closet with no problem and is easy to set up - sort of like a deck chair.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: just buy it
customer_reviews.text: if you're on the fence and figure it's over $100 and you can get by flipping your bike over, propping it up against a tree, or like me, using your bike rack mounted to your car as a bike stand, just fork over the money and be glad you did. wish i had gotten one years ago
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bike Stand
customer_reviews.text: This bike stand is the best that I have ever used personally. I do standard maintenance and adjustments on my bikes. This bike stand is stable, easy to set up and take down for easy storage. The components are more than substantial and, as with all bike stands, use common sense when setting up and clamping a bike to it. Rotating bike clamp is substantial and holds extremely well. Just get familiar with it and do not force any adjustments. Common sense. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great -truly!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, good quality, nice features, and works as advertised. It's at least as solid as it looks in the video review. I've tested it with my 50-lb electric bike, using the clamp horizontally, and it doesn't come close to tipping or slipping even with this heavy-weight beauty; it's as stable as I can expect a home-garage unit to be. It compares favorably to competing stands and it looks better that any of them. Be sure to spend some time learning to use the stand, particularly in learning FIRST, to tighten the nuts, and then locking with the quick-release.levers. I'm 6'1" (185 cm) and the stand extends very nicely and easily to fit my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: El Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Strong and feels capable. Worth the money. Only used it a few times so can't say how it will hold up but looks but works well so far. Not the smallest or easy to store or take on the road and maybe more than some folks will need but after shopping around it better to be big than small. For the money I think it's good.
customer_reviews.author: C.James

customer_reviews.title: This Bike work stand is perfect for a Bike enthusiast like me
customer_reviews.text: This Bike work stand is perfect for a Bike enthusiast like me. Sure beats having someone hold the bike up while you turn the pedals, shift the gears, etc. No more bungee chord rigging the bike from the gazebo rafter on my back yard patio either. I suppose if I owned a bike repair shop I would upgrade but for a biker who needs to do occasional work on his/her bike this thing is perfect. Well made easy to use and the price on Amazon is right. Folds up nicely for storage. What's not to like? Serves the purpose and I give it a five star thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Rickyo

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and easy to Store!
customer_reviews.text: This is very well designed. The stand holds the bike securely in a position that is convenient to work on. The height is adjustable. The tool folds up into a small and space friendly item. I keep my bike stand up all the time just to the side of my work area. I can work standing or- if I like - in a seated position. Having a cycle in a convenient position to work on is SO much easier than the alternative. I am VERY pleased with this purchase. I consider this a really good value for the money. The tool tray is quite handy as well.
customer_reviews.author: jancamp

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a very good bike stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid bike stand, and for a “normal” bike it is probably more than sufficient. I use it for a bike that is right around the upper weight limit for this stand, which also does have a “typical” frame for mounting, and this stand can’t quite handle it as I hoped. Still, it does allow me to get my heavy, awkward bike off the ground to work on it, so overall I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tate

customer_reviews.title: this is a great inexpensive alternative to the Park Tools one
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars because, thought it rocks back and forth, I'm sure it wasn't designed for a 56lb e-bike. Keep in mind, if that's what you want this rack for, look for something with a higher weight rating. I'm just waiting for this neck to snap. For normal bikes, this is a great inexpensive alternative to the Park Tools one. The tool tray is convenient, since it allows me to move the rack from my room to my garage without having to lug my tool box with me. When it folds up, it is really slim and easy to carry with one hand. Overall, great! UPDATE: A couple years in, and still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Corndog

customer_reviews.title: Always wanted one
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance with a price as low as this and was very pleasantly surprised. It checks all the boxes. Has easy folding, easy adjustment, clamps the bike sturdily, provides good space for tools and seems to be very well made, although is very light. Already totally swapped out shifters and brakes on a spare bike which would have been impossible without this.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the others!
customer_reviews.text: I don't buy Chinese products, especially tools, unless there is no other choice. Well, when I checked the name brands, all 3X more expensive, they were made in China as well!! Give me a break! My only (minor) complaint is the clamp holding the seat tube. It's a bit cumbersome, but not bad at all! Well worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This stand is adequate but not at all robust. I am concerned that the plastic teeth on the rotating head will soon strip if I’m not always careful. If you are on a budget, the stand will hold your bike, just don’t set your expectations to high.
customer_reviews.author: S_____

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it looks impressive. Lightweight yet seemingly well built. The only issue I can see is the plastic teeth in the rotating head, not sure how long that will last. Setup was easy and quick. Securing bike with clamp was a little awkward but that might have been me using it for the first time. Once in the clamp the bike was fairly secure and easy to work on albeit a little unstable. I remedied the instability by placing the front tire on the ground and elevating the rear tire. All in all after one use it seems to be worth the money spent and will be a useful tool in maintaining our bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised with this being a cheaper option how nice it really is. The ease of use is awesome, holds my Focus Jam 27.5 Large frame very well with 0 issues. I dont see why people are spending 180-220$ when this works just as good. You can tell by my poor sentence structure i wasnt paid for this review. Just a honest guy
customer_reviews.author: Rob V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Specialized Turbo Levo. Very sturdy for such a heavy bike.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Osaki

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the stand two weeks. Have used it three times already. The quality of the stand exceeded my expectations for the money. Only time will tell whether it holds up long term. I hold my Specialized Roubaix road bike by the saddle stem. Works great. My sole disappointment is that the toggle on the clamp will not close it tight enough without having to screw if open and closed a bit to remove and grasp the stem.
customer_reviews.author: rec

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work as it should edit: company contacted me and sending replacement part
customer_reviews.text: Looks pretty great, except the head wont swivel. the teeth wont disengage enough to let it rotate. Unless im missing something? Idk product support takes you to some furniture place. Edit: The company said they'd send me a replacement part. If this one works, this is a 5 star product. I'll leave it as a 4, just for having to deal with the issue.
customer_reviews.author: mike taber

product_meta.title: Bikehand Bike Repair Stand - Home Portable Bicycle Mechanics Workstand - for Mountain Bikes and Road Bikes Maintenance
feature_bullets: LIGHT , STRONG & PORTABLE: The repair stand is made of full light alloy aluminum with heavy duty plastic strong head and clamps. It is light weight, and compact when folded. It is very convenient, durable and well-designed.

HEIGHT ADJUSTED: Quick Release Adjustable (1m-1.5m or 39"-59" Fully extended). The height, tilt, and angle all have quick release strong skewers. So that is very helpful when wanting to get the bike in the optimal working position for you.

ROTATED HEAD: Smart design: head rotated:360 Degree by quick release and turning knob. The teeth and clamp are well made and heavy duty. It could hold max Standard 55 lbs or heavy duty 110 lbs bike at any angle.
TOOL PLATE: Foldable magnetic tool plate included. Simply attach or remove the tool plate by hand for quick easy set up and storage.

DURABLE: The bike workstand was released to the market for more than 10 years. It has been approved one of most reliable and durable bicycle repair stands available for home or shop uses. We can offer 5 years warranty on the rack and keep enough parts for any claim in our warehouse.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
